ISSUE.TITLE: Quadlet does not remove anonymous volumes on service stop
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description Services generated by Quadlet does not remove their anonymous volumes after stopping. This is due to the `ExecStop` command not having the `-v` flag set. ### Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Add `sleep.container` to quadlet ```systemd [Unit] Description=A do-nothing container [Container] Image=docker.io/alpine:latest Network=none RunInit=yes Exec=sleep infinity Volume=/data ``` 2. Start `sleep.service` 3. Run `podman volume list` and confirm that an anonymous volume was created 4. Stop `sleep.service` 5. Run `podman volume list` ### Describe the results you received The anonymous volume should be gone ### Describe the results you expected The anonymous volume is still there. COMMIT.MESSAGE: Automatically remove anonymous volumes when removing a container If you are running a quadlet with anonymous volumes, then the volume will leak ever time you restart the service. This change will cause the volume to be removed. Fixes: https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/20070 Signed-off-by: Daniel J Walsh <dwalsh@redhat.com>
